PageTitle: access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue length
FuncDef:
The access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue length command sets a size threshold for the UM message queue, so that the device can control the UM message queue usage. When the usage of the UM message queue reaches a specified threshold, the system decreases or increases the CPCAR value to control the number of user packets that can be sent to the CPU.
The undo access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue length command restores the default setting.
By default, the size threshold for the UM message queue is 24 KB.
CLIs: access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue length <length-value>
undo access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue length <length-value>

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a size threshold for the UM message queue.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 48, in KB.

Examples: [~HUAWEI-aaa] access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue length 32
ExtraInfo: When a large number of users go online and the system CPU is busy, run the access-speed adjustment system-state threshold access-queue command to set a proper size threshold for the UM message queue (the size threshold serves as the denominator for queue usage calculation), so that the device can adjust the UM message queue usage to control the number of user packets that can be sent to the CPU, as well as the user access rate.
